topic.title: Using Mac OS X Installer
topic.shortdesc: Installation of the agent with the Mac OS X installer

body.p: The FusionInventory project provides 2 Mac OS X packages: one for powerpc computers and the other for Intel macs.
The package is a .pkg file, and is designed for silent installation. Agent's configuration needs to be done before install, by going into the package, and edit the Content\Resources\agent.cfg file.
By default, the agent runs as a daemon, and stores his files in /opt/fusioninventory-agent.
Please note that FusionInventory agent is not a Mac OS X application, and his invisible for users.
Once configured, the agent can be deployed either manually (by double clicking on the .pkg file), nor automatically using tools like Apple Remote Desktop.
